channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023080164
item.description:
Report X-2023080164

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg brought back to station by driver after recipient refused it due to mottling of box and bottom edge has disintegrated by becoming wet and separating. DescribePack: Contents are 2 part system of disinfectant and sterilant. Caps are vented and is fully disclosed on box exterior. The cap on one jug actually became loose which allowed internal leaking. When the cap was tightened, the jug became secure again. The cap may have been loose but not noticable until the jostling of the delivery van caused the package to actually leak. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leak was a very small amount. It absorbed into the cardboard of the outer carton. No mitigation necessary as the package was segregated immediately upon return to station.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was brought to QA attention that the package was leaking when the package handler opened the door to begin unloading.. It was leaking prior to being moved on the trailer floor. DescribePack: Unable to see exact location of leak.. It appeared to be coming from the bottom of the medal jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quick approach to door with proper hazardous spill materials and taken to hazard cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070337
item.description:
Report X-2023070337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/2/2023 at approximately 1155, Dangerous Goods Adminsitration received a call from Employee 223990 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a resin spill. The shipment consisted of 2metal cans inside of a fiberboard box. Both cans appeared to have leaked due to compromised closures. The cause of the damage is unknown. Per the shipper's request, the package will prepared for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070259
item.description:
Report X-2023070259

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was signs of release was found during sort operations at the Memphis Dangerous goods building. The fiberboard box contained twelve small metal cans separated by fiberboard dividers. One of the of the cans was punctured just above the bottom chime causing it to release all of it's contents. All the contents of the fiberboard box were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 2 an overpack was found to have an odor, upon investigating the odor, a leaking steel jerrican was discovered as the source of hte odor. It contained UN1263, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 3, II. The jerrican was pulled from the overpack and placed into a steel salvage drum. The shipper stated it should be disposed of so it was sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070205
item.description:
Report X-2023070205

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/8/2023 at approximately 1100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill from a multiple-piece shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing metal cans of paint. Two of the three pieces were compromised. The master shipment, ending in -5585, contained 4 cans of paint and the shipment ending in -5600 containing 2 cans paint. The master package had minor spillage the cause was unknown. One of the metal cans completely from the shipment ending in -5600, due to body structure failing. The remainder of both shipments wer placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023071215
item.description:
Report X-2023071215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: NASH admin discovered a leaking fiberboard box on the flexslide. Admin did not initially suspect this was a hazardous material as there were no diamond labels or hazmat paperwork attached to the packaging. Gloves were donned and package with all absorbed spillage was placed in a double-lined tote/bin and transported to the HMPA for further investigation. Pictures of the original packaging were found on Spidr. The shipper TRU VALUE/PROMAX could not verify the presence of a hazmat or whether content was (as stated on original packaging) six 1 gallon plastic bottles of Rooto 10% Ammonia; their SDS service through Ambipar could not provide any details of Section 14 of the SDS provided. In the shipper's SDS Section 14, all descriptors (except for PG: III) were listed as NA. The manufacturer Rooto Corp provided admin with an SDS Section 14 that described the material as UN2672, Ammonia solution, 8 III. PGH was kept informed of all developments. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process. DescribePack: One of six 1gal bottles lost 0.7 gallon due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned. The package and all spillage was placed in a double-lined, lidded tote and moved under ventilation for further investigation. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process.

  • Description: On 7/1/2023 at approximately 1115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a comsumer commodity spill. The shipment consisted of 5 Fiberboard box pieces , one packed with 18 bottles fo perfume, in which 2 bottles leaked from being broken. The cause of the damage is unknown. The damaged pieces awaits disposal and the remianing contents were placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023071147
item.description:
Report X-2023071147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071147 SequenceEvent: contents arrived in a damage state. The box has leakage damage from interior contents causing item to be undeliverable. Once picked up from unload area by QA, item was brought to be processed and handled in designated area. DescribePack: The content within the package had a loose top that didn't stay sealed, therefore causing the item to leak and deteriorate the box it was packaged in. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were picked up by QA and brought over to the hazmat cage in a bucket to be processed and dealt with accordingly. 2. X-2023071150 SequenceEvent: Item was called out for QA to tend too. Once we arrived to grab damage, it was obvious the contents were leaking internally. Item was brought to the hazmat cage in a tote and tended too accordingly. DescribePack: Contents within shipping box had a missing cap. This allowed for leakage to occur and damage to be done to the item. The box used for shipping was warped to the point it was no longer sealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a tote and brought over to hazmat cage to be dealt with accordingly.

item.title: Report X-2023061395
item.description:
Report X-2023061395

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to our spill office located in our Memphis Hub location when it was seen package was leaking. Package consisted of a steel drum containing UN3082. It was seen upon arrival of spill cleanup agent that the top chime of the drum was damaged. It was not known how the damage to the drum occurred. It was also seen commodity was leaking from cap placed in bung hole allowing for an estimated 5L to spill. Package to be placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper is to be contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for return to shipper as FedEx Policy does not allow for international shipment of salvage drums.
